column4: my ubuntu hangs for about four minutes before it finally boots
once you get booted, run:  dmesg | less     and read through, look for large gaps in the left colomn (those are seconds since the kernel came up)
the very last line is only at 41.95
hmm, strange. Is the RAM healthy?
1.5 GB, i just ran memtest a few days ago
so the dmesg is quite quick, what GPU do you use?
it seems like the hang occurs while unpacking the initrd
could try reinstalling the linux-image-2.x.x.x   see if it helps
uname -r   will show the kernel version
and do as arghx says too :)
arghx: at least one of you was right... whatever I just did solved the problem, thanks!
